joxy.utils

Class JoxyGraphics

  • java.lang.Object
    • joxy.utils.JoxyGraphics

  • public class JoxyGraphics
extends Object
    A class that tries to make the default Java font rendering more like KDE does.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static boolean NATIVE_TEXT_RENDERING
      Whether text rendering should be done by a call to Qt (instead of doing it in Java).
      static boolean TEXT_CACHING
      Whether Qt-rendered text should be cached.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JoxyGraphics() 

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static void drawString(Graphics2D g2, String str, float x, float y)
      Draws a string with the given Graphics object.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • NATIVE_TEXT_RENDERING

        public static final boolean NATIVE_TEXT_RENDERING
        Whether text rendering should be done by a call to Qt (instead of doing it in Java).
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • TEXT_CACHING

        public static final boolean TEXT_CACHING
        Whether Qt-rendered text should be cached. This has no meaning when NATIVE_TEXT_RENDERING = false.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • JoxyGraphics

        public JoxyGraphics()

    • Method Detail

      • drawString

        public static void drawString(Graphics2D g2,
              String str,
              float x,
              float y)
        Draws a string with the given Graphics object. This is done by a call to Qt.
        Parameters:
        g2 - The Graphics2D object we are painting on. The font family, font size and color to draw with, are inferred from this object.
        str - The String to draw.
        x - The x-coordinate of the left side of the text.
        y - The y-coordinate of the lower side of the text.
